TopicTitle: [1.11.x] AmpYear Main & Reserve Power Manager (v1.5.9.0) 22nd Feb 2021

Articles.Content:
Hi JPLRepo - Thanks for your work on AMPYear and DeepFreeze - they are excellent and work great. 

I've been testing out my replica of [@Kuzzter](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/111501-kuzzter/) Intrepid starship to Jool and while trying to work out the life-support aspect of it, I found something that I can offer as a suggestion for AMPYear support of the mods for <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr>-LS / <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr>-Core.

I'm using a 1.25m Nuclear Reactor that comes with the [@RoverDude](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/105198-roverdude/) - <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr> Core (also bundled into <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr>-ART and MKS mods) and found that AMPYear currently only shows the parts max generatable Electrical charge  eg: AMPYear only shows a static 230 EC for a 1.25m reactor.

<iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/122420-113-usi-core-reactors-and-kontainers-v024/&do=embed"></iframe>

However, [@RoverDude](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/105198-roverdude/) reactors work like the Harvester Drill so it has an ideal operating temp (1000K) and if it's above or below that, the reactors Thermal Efficiency rate degrades the amount of EC the reactor produces. eg 230EC at 10% effeciency = 23EC

I tested this using AMPYear 1.3.4.0 and with 2x1.25m <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr>-Core reactors (460EC/s) and a healthy 115EC/s load on them. I also had the HotSpot mod installed to see the change in temp of the parts.  

With the radiators enabled and the Reactors close to their ideal 1000K temp, I'm getting about a positive 333EC/s adding to my batteries.  

When I shutdown the radiator panels and wait for the reactors to cool (takes a Minmus day or so), the Thermal Efficiency of both reactors drop below 10% (dropping from 460EC to somewhere <46EC) and I end up with a net loss of 62EC/s which matches up with expectations. 

As far as I can tell, the reactors Thermal Efficiency is visible. However, I've no idea if that's a values you are able to READ from within the AMPYear mod. If you are able to see the TE values, can I offer the suggestion to have these reactors change their EC production from a static number to a floating calculated rate dictated by the Thermal Efficiency? (Also logged as a GitHUB issue for you)

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/I0Zl6/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

Two quick questions- 

1) Is the Dawn ION Engine fix coming in soon? - it doesn't read as taking charge in <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>.

2) Is there a way to calculate surface darkness time? even something as simple as rotational period / 2 would help so we wouldn't need to check the tracking station for every planet we want to go to.

Answer-

1) No - What is the Dawn ION Engine? and what fix? There is no Bug report on Github. I don't even know what part you are talking about. what mod is it from?

2) What is your request? You want the surface darkness time displayed in the Dark-Side window?

HI JPLRepo

The Dawn ION Engine is the stock ION engine supplied with KSP - elogateumsato might be referring to my post a few posts back. 

Sorry I haven't logged an issue yet - I didn't want to bother you with an issue unless someone else can confirm it is a problem for someone other than myself. Being a stock part I figured was probably supported and I was just seeing a problem on my side. 

- For those following along at home:
    - Can someone/anyone confirm that the STOCK ION engine doesn't register as using EC is an issue for you as well - if so I'll log the issue with pics on GITHUB .

I'm using AmpYear solely for its ability to track EC usage and night time calcs in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> (since Fusebox isn't being supported right now). I disabled a lot of its functionality because I will use kOS to manage craft power systems so before I call this an issue I want to make sure this isn't working as intended because I disabled something:

[![Nxj3E3el.png](http://i.imgur.com/Nxj3E3el.png)](http://i.imgur.com/Nxj3E3e.png)

AmpYear isn't picking up any EC usage for the Avionics Package

>

> AmpYear isn't picking up any EC usage for the Avionics Package
> 

There is a bug with ModuleCommand in the current release version, and that part from <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> Sounding Rockets is using ModuleCommand.  

Will be fixed in next version.  
[https://github.com/JPLRepo/AmpYear/issues/25](https://github.com/JPLRepo/AmpYear/issues/25)

V1.3.5 released.  

Compatible with Realism Overhaul and a bunch of bug fixes. See the changelog in the <abbr title="Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it."><abbr title="Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it."><abbr title="Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it.">OP</abbr></abbr></abbr> for details.  

EDIT: Forgot to mention in the ChangeLog, the KSPedia pages have been updated for the new SI unit display functionality.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-08-06T08:55:24Z" title="08/06/2016 08:55  AM" data-short="7 yr">August 6, 2016</time> by JPLRepo**

> 
> 
> On 10/06/2016 at 5:31 PM, Errol said:
> 
> 
> I have found an incompatibility for this mod, submitting this as a bug report. There are no crash logs to post.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Tested on a clean install of KSP 1.1.2 x64
> 
> 
> 
> 
> <iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/105289-11-the-plugin-workshop-small-plugins-of-varied-function/&do=embed"></iframe>
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [**(Semi-)Saturatable Reaction Wheels - Download/Source**](https://github.com/Crzyrndm/RW-Saturatable/releases) Is the specific mod that is causing a conflict.  
>   
> 
> Bug: Having both mods installed stops reaction wheel saturation from modifying effective torque. (RW window still show diminished torque available, but you can still freely use all reaction wheels if there is electricity for them)  
>   
> 
> Each mod functions beautifully on their own.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Repro steps; build a simple probe with electric charge and reaction wheels, use girders as skid pads, and use rotation to start the vessel spinning. If RW saturable is working after a short time your probe should stop spinning due to diminished torque available and the friction of the surface. 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Cross posting to plugin workshop.
> 

Yeah you see, this is what happens when you don't file an issue on GitHub it gets completely missed....

KSP v1.1.3, AmpYear v1.3.5.0 and ScanSat v16.4, Win10

Not sure how significant this is but I'm getting a whole load of AmpYear log entries (dozens per second) in the [debug window](https://www.dropbox.com/s/kn3v7gj42k8xyel/AmpYear%20Debug.png?dl=0) and [output log](https://www.dropbox.com/s/dvlikmo2dg1b9ss/output_log.txt?dl=0) (obviously) related to ScanSat. And maybe I'm wrong, but as a consequence, AmpYear isn't recognizing the power drain from the Multi-Spectral scanner that I have mounted and running over Kerbin ([screenshot](https://www.dropbox.com/s/n4nkhqjccw3orrb/AmpYear%20Parts%20List.png?dl=0)).  Also, when I timewarp, scan data isn't returned.  This probably isn't an AmpYear problem.

I believe I have the latest versions of the mods installed and working properly.  What might I be doing wrong?

**Edited <time datetime="2016-08-10T07:14:11Z" title="08/10/2016 07:14  AM" data-short="7 yr">August 10, 2016</time> by Brigadier**

And maybe I'm wrong, but as a consequence, AmpYear isn't recognizing the power drain from the Multi-Spectral scanner that I have mounted and running over Kerbin ([screenshot](https://www.dropbox.com/s/n4nkhqjccw3orrb/AmpYear%20Parts%20List.png?dl=0)).

Yep it appears new version of ScanSat 16.4 has changed how it works internally.Unfortumately I seem to have a bug which means it keeps repeating that log message over and over which is a shame otherwise it would just issue it once and disable ScanSat integration.  

Go back to the previous version of ScanSat and it should be ok until I can release a fix.  
[https://github.com/JPLRepo/AmpYear/issues/40](https://github.com/JPLRepo/AmpYear/issues/40)

Could AMPYear maybe detect and implement this?

Just wanted to say thank you for this mod. I had several webpages plus another mod for what this one does and I am still checking the math with my calculator. Now I am giving it a try and I think it will make life much easier in KSP ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

I'm thinking of dropping the Power Turn feature/option from AmpYear.  

I just feel it probably doesn't add a lot of value, do many people actually use it?

From the <abbr title="Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it.">OP</abbr>:  

TurnBooster  

Allows you to use electrical power to harness <abbr title="Stability Augmentation System">SAS</abbr>/Reaction Wheel modules for additional turning power. Boosting them by 25%.

> 
> 
> Just now, JPLRepo said:
> 
> 
> From the <abbr title="Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it.">OP</abbr>:  
> 
> TurnBooster  
> 
> Allows you to use electrical power to harness <abbr title="Stability Augmentation System">SAS</abbr>/Reaction Wheel modules for additional turning power. Boosting them by 25%.
> 

Oops, forgot to read the <abbr title="Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it.">OP</abbr> (again), sorry.

Nope, still don't use it.
I think it's a good move to drop the TurnBooster, I think they already are <abbr title="Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it.">OP</abbr> without it, so.

Feature suggestion: If the parts window is open and you deselect the subsystem button, the parts window should close.

Unless there's a case for keeping the parts window open regardless.
